title: Cat. 83.3  A Fisherman Drinking beside His Canoe, 1894
publication_title: Gauguin Paintings, Sculpture, and Graphic Works at the Art Institute of Chicago
content:
<section class="osci-tk-epub-section tombstone" id="tombstone">A Fisherman Drinking Beside His Canoe  
1894  
Second state of two  
Wood-block print, printed twice in brown and black ink, on cream wove Japanese paper laid down on cream wove Japanese paper; 205 × 138 mm (image/primary/secondary support)  
The Art Institute of Chicago, Print Sales Miscellaneous Fund, 1947.688  
Guérin 46, Kornfeld 33 II/II  
For the verso, see fig. 83.3.1

</section><section class="osci-tk-epub-section provenance" id="provenance">Marcel Guérin (1873–1948), Paris.

Sold by Richard H. Zinser (1884–1984), Forest Hills, New York, to the Art Institute of Chicago, 1947.

</section><section class="osci-tk-epub-section exhibitions" id="exhibitions">Art Institute of Chicago, Gauguin: Paintings, Drawings, Prints, Sculpture, Feb. 12–Mar. 29, 1959, cat. 170; New York, Metropolitan Museum of Art, Apr. 21–May 31, 1959, as Le Pecheur Buvant Aupres de sa Pirogue.

Munich, Haus der Kunst, Paul Gauguin, Apr. 1–May 29, 1960, cat. 192, as Trinkender Fischer Neben Seinem Kahn.

Vienna, Österreichische Galerie im Oberen Belvedere, Paul Gauguin, June 7–July 31, 1960, cat. 82, as Trinkender Fischer Neben Seinem Kahn.

</section><section class="osci-tk-epub-section references" id="references">Art Institute of Chicago and Metropolitan Museum of Art, New York, Gauguin: Paintings, Drawings, Prints, Sculpture, exh. cat. (Art Institute of Chicago, 1959), p. 87, cat. 170.

Haus der Kunst, Paul Gauguin, with essays by Germain Bazin and Harold Joachim, exh. cat. (Ausstellungsleitung München e.V. Haus der Kunst, 1960), p. 35, cat. 192.

Oberes Belvedere, Paul Gauguin, 1848–1903, exh. cat. (Österreichische Galerie im Oberen Belvedere, 1960), p. 44, cat. 82.

Elizabeth Mongan, Eberhard W. Kornfeld, and Harold Joachim, Paul Gauguin: Catalogue Raisonné of His Prints, with assistance of Christine E. Stauffer (Galerie Kornfeld, 1988), p. 148, cat. 33.

</section><section class="osci-tk-epub-section other_documentation" id="other_documentation">Inscribed along bottom, in graphite: Paul Gauguin 1895 / Le Pécheur Buvant aupres de sa Pirogue unique

Collector’s stamp lower left, in black ink: MG

</section><section epub:type="footnotes" id="footnotes">The collector’s stamp of Marcel Guérin’s (Lugt 1872b) on the verso. See also Elizabeth Mongan, Eberhard W. Kornfeld, and Harold Joachim, Paul Gauguin: Catalogue Raisonné of His Prints with assistance of Christine H. Stauffer (Galerie Kornfeld, 1988), pp. 148–49, cat. 33.

According to permanent receipt 9129 and receipt of object 10787, the object arrived from Mr. Richard H. Zinser, 7022 Manse Street, Forest Hills, New York, at the Art Institute on Dec. 1, 1947, for purchase.

The collector’s stamp of Marcel Guérin (Lugt 1872b).

</section><section id="figures">Cat. 83.3 A Fisherman Drinking beside His Canoe, 1894.

fig. 83.3.1 Verso of Gauguin’s A Fisherman Drinking Beside His Canoe, 1894. The Art Institute of Chicago, 1947.688

</section>
